text: Hans Michael Frank (23 May 1900 – 16 October 1946) was a German lawyer. He worked for the Nazi Party during the 1920s and 1930s. Later he became a high- ranking official in Nazi Germany. Frank was prosecuted during the Nuremberg trials for his role in the Holocaust. He was found guilty of war crimes and crimes against humanity, and was executed on 16 October 1946. Before his execution, Frank returned to the Catholic Church. == Related pages == * World War II * Nazi Party * The Holocaust * War crimes * Crimes against humanity * The Nuremberg Trials Category:1900 births Category:1946 deaths Category:Executed German people Category:Executed Nazis Category:Lawyers from Baden-Württemberg Category:German Roman Catholics Category:German war criminals Category:Government ministers of Nazi Germany Category:Holocaust perpetrators Category:Members of the Reichstag (Nazi Germany) Category:Members of the Reichstag (Weimar Republic) Category:People executed by hanging Category:People from Karlsruhe Category:Politicians from Baden-Württemberg Category:Politicians of the Nazi Party Category:SS officers
title: Hans Frank
